results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: It's different today
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: This is a general recruiting film for the Royal Australina Navy. A young seaman waiting to join his ship is regaled by an old sailor with a discussion on ‘how things used to be when I was young’ intercut with action shots of navy manouvres and training exercises.

results.title: It's as easy as selling candy to a baby
results.brief_description: Examines the powerful influence of television in selling sugar-coated snack foods to children. One out of five commercials advertises food or beverage products. As well, medical experts document the health costs of these mesmerising messages to chilren, who as a result of sugar-rich diets, are suffering irreparable damage to their teeth. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: It's an outdoor world
results.creator_credit: Dennis Trewin, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Made to give a balanced view of typical occupations where the work is largely out of doors, showing the relation of field work to administrative and clerical elements and the kind of opportunities that are open for young people interested in outdoor work. Cast includes Norman Kaye and John Derum.

results.title: It's all up to you
results.brief_description: This short animated cartoon tells the story of two friends. One eats wisely and remains young and active. The other starts smoking, eats too much and becomes lazy and fat. His foolish way of living leads to a premature death.
results.description: This short animated cartoon tells the story of two friends. One eats wisely and remains young and active. The other starts smoking, eats too much and becomes lazy and fat. His foolish way of living leads to a premature death.

results.title: It's all right, it's only a customer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
John Cleese plays four different Herberts - head office employees who have lost touch with the real world of customers and the company business. Ronnie Barker plays a long-suffering customer who is passed from one Herbert to another in his attempt to place a slightly non-standard order. Cast also includes Jonathan Lynn, Connie Booth, Bernard McKenna, Renny Lister. Narrated by Keith Barron.

results.title: It's all man-made
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, James Archibald, Department of Environment and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Traces the impact of man’s industrial pursuits on the environment, focusing on the United Kingdom, and how industrialisation can work side-by-side with improving the natural landscape. Commentary by Ian Morrison.

results.title: It's all been great!
results.brief_description:
Wayne is not only a playing member of the local BBC Bowling Club but he also plays tennis and captains a basketball team. Here he speaks of his various achievements, his love of sport and particularly his love for his family.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: It's about time
results.creator_credit: Danny Carter and British Information Services
results.brief_description: This film presents some extravagant or unusually designed historic time-pieces. Captures the ingenuity of horologists and craftsmen seen at work in a large factory producing clocks and watches on a mass production line. Commentary by Frank Hawkins.
